p: Three compounds were isolated from the A. lavandulaefolia for the first time. They were identified as 1,8-cineole, chamazulene, and β-caryophyllene by comparison of their spectral data with those of the literature ( 1H-, 13C-NMR, and mass spectra) [ 36, 37, 38]. 1,8-Cineole is an oxygenated monoterpenoid. Chamazulene and β-caryophyllene are sesquiterpenes. Their structures are shown in Figure 1.
